reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can only echo the other excellent reviews of this hotel. Their staff are something special and many hotels could learn from them.
reviews.title: Service with a smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As has been stated in other reviews, this is a great, small hotel. It is an easy ten minute walk to the cathedral area. The staff are very friendly and helpful including providing excellent recommendations for restaurants that serve "local" cuisine. The rooms are clean, functional and relatively large by European standards. The interior of the hotel is a wonderful combination of modernism and historical preservation.
reviews.title: "Charming Small Hotel"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights, and took the hotel breakfast each morning. The breakfast is well worth the price in that all of the ingredients are local and of excellent quality. The wait staff took the time to explain how to enjoy the local breads, jams, meats and cheeses.
reviews.title: Why can't all hotels be like this?

reviews.text: This is a great hotel.
reviews.title: A Fantastic Hotel with wonderful staff in a beautiful city.

reviews.text: Like nearly every other reviewer, our stay at Hotel Altair was exemplary - why can't all hotels be like this? Stylish and tasteful decor, comfortable, good location, and above all, people who do everything to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Though we only stayed for one night, nothing was too much trouble, even arranging an emergency dental appointment. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Wonderful, wonderful place!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you use google for the map to Hotel Altair it is a little confusing, i remember reading a post regarding parking at the la salle car park and that the hotel was situated one block from The Boqueria des Roques.We managed to use these 2 points to find the hotel rather the map!
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel

reviews.text: Upon arriving the staff were very friendly and told us to park the car at La Salle and the bags would be in our room upon arrival.We had a room on the third floor (attic) both the bathroom and bedroom had skylight windows with electronic shutters.The views esp from the bathroom were amazing rolling hills with cathedral spires. Great book Marvillas de Galicia in the room.
reviews.title: Great example of historic restoration mixed with modern decor, a very professional staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with the lift noise but only 2 rooms on the 3rd floor and we used the stairs.
reviews.title: Stylish boutique hotel... so long as you dont mind the elevator noise

reviews.text: Breakfast of cheeses was a delight and because i am Gluten free they had purchased special bread for me.It was funny when they asked if we wanted any fruit,I was thinking more of a fruit plate but each table received a fruit bowl, i counted 10 whole pcs of fruit !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: More pastries/cereals are on offer along with juices.
reviews.title: Think this hotel should be knocked up to first place!

reviews.text: The staff at this hotel will bend over backward to make sure your visit goes well. My husband and I came with our son, his wife and our new grandson and we were fortunate to have the top floor rooms (there were only two up there!). We felt we were in a large apartment with glorious views and space galore. The decor was lovely. There is nothing I can say but praise for the staff. They were so friendly and accomodating and could not have been more helpful. I think the only thing that might be of concern for some is that there is no on site parking, but there is parking nearby and the location of the hotel makes it so convenient to walk everywhere in the city.... and I am a person with issues walking.... and if I say this is convenient, it IS conveninent.
reviews.title: A friendly and superior hotel in the middle of a unique city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at Hotel Altair was great. Very nicely renovated hotel, walking distance to everything you would want to see, including restaurants they recommended which were outstanding. Very helpful staff, good breakfast, good recommendations. Their sister hotel is a block away (Costa Vella) and has a nice garden to have a coffee or drink in. We very much enjoyed our stay at the hotel and in Santiago. I thought the room we got was fairly generously sized for European standards. I highly recommend Altair, especially for the money.
reviews.title: Great boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Altair is a small hotel, but its looks can fool you. Me and my husband stayed in a ground floor which had its own 'gazebo', very quiet, adorable and relaxing, where we could read and unstring from our long and pleasant walks. The staff is absolutely amiable and attentive. The girls at the front desk would explain and suggest every little thing we wanted to know with a big smile. Its a simple and very clean room. There's a nearby parking where we stopped our car and did not have to use it while staying there because everything is in a walking distance and away from all the fuss and noise of the main historical sights. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Santiago de Compostela, a gorgeous place to visit.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel; First rate staff; definitely worthed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel in Tripadvisor. It was chosen as the 1st favourite hotel in Santiago de Compostela. Now I understand why... Although it was a bit hard to find it, since all streets in Santiago are narrow, confusing and all look the same, once we found it, it was like finding an oasis. No exaggeration. The welcome was very warm. It is a typical house in the old town, only 10 min. walk from the Cathedral. It is very well decorated. It has a lift! Our room (standard) was incredibly clean and neat. The bathroom was one of the cleanest ones I've ever seen. It included toiletries by Yves Rocher. We had a small balcony facing a private garden, where we could see all kinds of trees. It was very relaxing, indeed. A flat TV and free WIFI Internet completed this amazing familiar hotel. Not to mention the breakfast: all fresh and natural products in a beautifully decorated and comfortable cafeteria downstairs. Undoubtedly, one of the best stays I've every experienced. Santiago de Compostela is an amazing city. Do not miss it!
reviews.title: The best hotel I've ever stayed at

reviews.text: I spent five nights here during a conference and loved everything about it - room, location, staff, style.
reviews.title: can't fault it

reviews.title: The most pleasant and helpful staff you will come across.

reviews.text: We got excellent non-touristy good Gallician addresses to eat. Thanks!
reviews.title: The best way to finish the Camino

reviews.text: My fellow pilgrim and I stayed at this hotel last week when we completed the Camino Portugues - for me it was a second visit, having stayed there when it originally opened in 2005. It really is everything other reviews have said, and more. Apart from being a very comfortable and well appointed hotel, the staff are the best thing about this hotel. Nothing is too much trouble for them. What a difference that attitude makes.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous; wonderful hotel, spectacular staff

reviews.text: I stayed there for 4 nights after walking 800km from France. It was so lovely and amazing. The staff were so kind and didn't treat be badly because I looked like a tired Pilgrim. I'll be back there soon.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel! Really should be listed as a 4-star, but at 3-star prices.
